strategy.name: Momentum Strategy
strategy.philosophy: Buy strong stocks making sustained upward moves and manage risk so that winners are larger than losers.
strategy.idealFor: Beginners who want a systematic, once-per-day decision process instead of constant screen watching.
strategy.coreRule: Protect capital first. Profits come from consistency, not prediction.

breakoutLookback.whatItIs: The number of past trading days a stock must exceed to qualify as a breakout.
breakoutLookback.whyItMatters: Stocks reaching new highs often attract institutional buyers, which can push prices higher.
breakoutLookback.howItAffectsTrades: Controls how 'strong' a trend must be before you consider entering.

tradeoffs.lower: More signals but more false breakouts.

breakoutLookback.defaultGuidance: 50 is a well-balanced setting used in many momentum models.
breakoutLookback.dangerZone: Below 20 turns this into short-term trading, which is much harder psychologically.
breakoutLookback.proTip: Your job is not to catch the bottom — it's to join proven strength.

pullbackMa.whatItIs: The moving average price that a stock can pull back toward before continuing higher.
pullbackMa.whyItMatters: Healthy trends often pause before resuming. Pullbacks help avoid buying extended moves.
pullbackMa.howItAffectsTrades: Improves entry prices and reduces emotional chasing.

tradeoffs.lower: Tighter entries but more missed trades.
tradeoffs.higher: More entries but higher risk of buying overstretched stocks.

pullbackMa.defaultGuidance: 20-day MA is widely used for swing structures.
pullbackMa.dangerZone: Ignoring pullbacks leads to buying tops — a classic beginner mistake.
pullbackMa.proTip: Professionals buy strength, but rarely buy spikes.

trendSmaStack.whatItIs: Three moving averages that define short, medium, and long-term trend direction.
trendSmaStack.whyItMatters: Trading with the broader trend dramatically increases probability.
trendSmaStack.howItAffectsTrades: Filters out stocks fighting the market direction.
trendSmaStack.defaultGuidance: This stack is considered the gold standard for trend confirmation.
trendSmaStack.dangerZone: Trading against the 200 SMA is where many beginners experience large losses.
trendSmaStack.proTip: Amateurs predict reversals. Professionals follow trends.

atrWindow.whatItIs: The number of days used to calculate the Average True Range, a measure of price movement.
atrWindow.whyItMatters: Volatility determines how wide your stop loss must be.
atrWindow.howItAffectsTrades: Higher volatility = larger swings = more emotional pressure.
atrWindow.dangerZone: Ignoring volatility is one of the fastest ways to oversize positions.
atrWindow.proTip: Position size should shrink as volatility expands.

maxAtrPct.whatItIs: The maximum daily movement allowed for stocks in your universe.

tradeoffs.higher: Bigger winners — but bigger emotional swings.

maxAtrPct.dangerZone: Above 25% is closer to speculation than systematic trading.
maxAtrPct.proTip: Your nervous system is part of your risk management.

minimumRr.whatItIs: The minimum ratio between potential profit and potential loss.
minimumRr.whyItMatters: Profitability comes from asymmetric outcomes, not high win rates.
minimumRr.howItAffectsTrades: Determines whether a setup is statistically worth taking.

tradeoffs.lower: Higher win rate illusion but fragile performance.

minimumRr.defaultGuidance: 2R allows you to be wrong half the time and still grow.
minimumRr.dangerZone: Below 1.5 makes long-term profitability mathematically difficult.
minimumRr.proTip: Think like a casino — small losses, larger wins.

breakevenR.whatItIs: When price moves in your favor by this multiple of risk, the stop moves to entry.
breakevenR.whyItMatters: Protects capital once the trade proves itself.
breakevenR.howItAffectsTrades: Reduces large losses but may exit winning trades early.
breakevenR.defaultGuidance: Ideal balance between protection and flexibility.
breakevenR.dangerZone: Moving stops emotionally instead of systematically.

trailAfterR.whatItIs: Defines when a trailing stop activates to lock in profits.
trailAfterR.whyItMatters: Lets winners run — the foundation of momentum trading.

tradeoffs.earlier: Locks profits but limits big winners.

trailAfterR.defaultGuidance: Widely used in systematic swing models.
trailAfterR.dangerZone: Taking profits too quickly is the most common beginner error.
trailAfterR.proTip: One large winner can pay for many small losses.

maxHoldingDays.whatItIs: The maximum time a trade can stay open.
maxHoldingDays.howItAffectsTrades: Prevents capital from being stuck in slow trades.
maxHoldingDays.dangerZone: Falling in love with a trade.
maxHoldingDays.proTip: Capital is inventory — keep it moving.

momentumWeights.whatItIs: Controls how recent vs long-term strength influences ranking.
momentumWeights.whyItMatters: Strong stocks tend to stay strong.
momentumWeights.howItAffectsTrades: Shapes the personality of your strategy.
momentumWeights.proTip: Robust strategies beat perfectly tuned ones.

socialOverlay.whatItIs: Measures unusual online attention and sentiment around a stock.
socialOverlay.whyItMatters: Crowd attention can accelerate price moves.

tradeoffs.enabled: Earlier discovery but risk of hype.

socialOverlay.defaultGuidance: Treat social data as a tailwind, not a reason to enter.
socialOverlay.dangerZone: If social hype is the ONLY reason for a trade — skip it.
socialOverlay.proTip: Attention follows price more often than it leads it.
